intro: Solenostemon koualensis, commonly known as the Madagascar violet, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and produces small, two-lipped flowers in shades of purple and blue. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
